images.caption: Figure 1:Clinicis a multilingual benchmark comprising samples fromfivetrustworthiness thrusts acrosssixhealthcare subdomains and15global languages. It encompasses testing of proprietary, open-weight models (small and large) and specialized medical language models.

Figure 2:Construction ofClinic.Step 1 involves data collection and mapping English samples to their corresponding multilingual versions. Step 2 applied a two-step prompting strategy to generate additional samples. Step 3 focused on sample validation to determine final inclusion inClinic.
Figure 3:Average (across false confidence, false question, and none of the above test) model hallucination accuracy (↑\uparrow) for high-, mid-, and low-resource languages.
Figure 4:Average (across five adversarial strategies) semantic similarity (↑\uparrow) between the model’s response to the original and adversarially perturbed sample.
Table 7:Average RtA (↑\uparrow) rate for Jailbreak across language-resource tiers.
Figure 6:Distribution of samples across sub-domains, where some samples fall under multiple categories.
Figure 7:Distribution of samples across different dimensions ofClinic
Figure 8:Average Skewness scores (↓\downarrow) forPreferenceacross language-resource tiers.
